thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger to sign Sergio Aguero this summer, says Ray Parlour | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger to sign Sergio Aguero this summer, says Ray Parlour | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger to sign Sergio Aguero this summer, says Ray Parlour | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news search metro follow us ray parlour

text:
Search Metro Follow us Ray Parlour backs Arsenal to sign Manchester City striker Sergio Aguero but doubts Gunners will pay his wages Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 1:59 pm Ray Parlour doubts Arsenal’s chances of paying Sergio Aguero’s wages (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal legend Ray Parlour has backed his former club to make a move for Manchester City star Sergio Aguero this summer – but doubts the Gunners will pay the Argentine’s wage demands. 
Aguero, 28, is clinging onto his future at the Etihad and could leave in the summer unless Pep Guardiola provides him with assurances over his first team chances. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
The Argentine was benched in favour of Gabriel Jesus in January but has been given another opportunity to impress following the Brazilian’s foot injury. 
Wenger’s future at the Emirates remains a mystery, too, but Parlour says he’d back a move for Aguero this summer – if Arsenal could afford his wages. Aguero could leave City this summer (Picture: Getty) 
‘That [move] would be good,’ Parlour told talkSPORT. 
‘That would be a nice signing, but £300,000-a-week though so I’m not too sure. 
‘Arsenal would be a much better team with Aguero in it [but] why would Man City want to sell him? 
‘They are trying to rule the Champions League over the next few years.’
